skillTree.localised_description: The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.

effects.description: Mount: Norscan Warhorse

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee (150s)

skillTree.localised_description: Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.

effects.description: Mount: Marauder Chariot

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee (150s)

skillTree.localised_description: This vicious beast carries a warshrine aloft, carrying blasphemous icons and unholy relics to battle in sight of the Chaos Gods.

effects.description: Mount: War Mammoth (Warshrine)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each nearby entity death (300)

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Scarred and brutish, even for monstrous beasts, these now-tamed creatures can shrug off incredible punishment.

effects.description:
HIDDEN Attribute: Perfect Vigour for Monstrous Arcanum monsters (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

skillTree.localised_description: The shadow of the Ruinous Powers looms large, protecting those who bear their mark.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10%

skillTree.localised_description: Although lacking the finesse of Elven magics, the sorceries of the north are no less potent, for they channel furious, Daemonic power.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5
Melee defence: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say noâ€¦

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +10% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +10%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +20% of experience earned between all other active Lords

	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +30%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Either in the quiet, snow-swept Northern expanses or on a screaming battlefield littered with death, Great Shaman Sorcerers are adept at enacting sacrifices in propitiation of the Dark Gods.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10%
Charge bonus: +20

skillTree.localised_description: Even in those Norscans most prone to bloody excess, the Great Shaman Sorcerers inspire paroxysms of frenzy that would be impossible without them.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -20%
	(Lord's army)
Passive ability: "Frenzy"

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for all units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Great Shaman Sorcerers are often the ones creating the impetus for war, using their prophetic influence to whisper visions of glory into the minds of the Chieftains.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +6%
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -20% for all units
	(Lord's army)

	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: With the correct ritual, even the Winds of Magic can be woven and wielded like a whip.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for rare spells
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10

skillTree.localised_description: In true Norscan fashion, whatever cunning pacts and bargains the Shaman Sorcerers pursue, they must seal them with blood. Not theirs, of courseâ€¦

effects.description: Income from post-battle loot: +30%

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -15%

skillTree.localised_description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5
Passive ability: "Arcane Conduit"

skillTree.localised_description: A Chaos Lord dominates â€“ lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who do not bend the knee to the Gods of the North soon find all they hold dear obliterated before them.

skillTree.localised_description: Only the fiercest creatures can survive the frozen north; the strongest are rounded up for war and starved into viciousness, ready for the next battle.

skillTree.localised_description: In spite of their savage nature, they are possessed of a savage code of conduct and form a loose brotherhood of those considered worthy.

skillTree.localised_description: No beast too large, no adversary too great; no quarry - mortal or otherwise - can evade them.

skillTree.localised_description: The intense cold and near-constant darkness of the far north make for a certain kind of killer.

skillTree.localised_description: The freezing darkness and stunning violence of the far north bring no small solace to those who have lost everything and wish to forget.

skillTree.localised_description: There can be no turning back for those whose souls are turning black.

effects.description: Ability: "Stand or Die!"
Replaces: "Rally!"

skillTree.localised_description: There is no other choice. There never was.

effects.description: Ability: "Fight or Die!"
Replaces: "Rally!"

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +5%

skillTree.localised_description: That which is not offered up to the Dark Gods of the North in tribute is harvested by their servants for their own petty gain.

effects.description: Income from post-battle loot: +5%
Income from post-battle loot: +10%
Income from post-battle loot: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: "You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."

	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -15% for all units

skillTree.localised_description: The bleak, brutal landscape of the far north breeds bloody, warlike tribes in thrall to Chaos' delicious, twisted power.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +5%
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Maybe it is the influence of the Dark Gods that has caused the populace to burgeon and proliferate beyond their natural bounds?

skillTree.localised_description: There's something about the harsh, unforgiving nature of northern life that makes its occupants fight harder and longer than many of their soft, southern equivalents.

skillTree.localised_description: Something strange - something no scholar really wishes to discover - governs who dies and who lives in the warlike northern wastes.

effects.description:

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: War and glory before the Gods are the determining elements in every decision made; there is nothing else worth living - or dying - for.

skillTree.localised_description: The tendrils (and tentacles!) of the Northern Gods reach down from the poles and far across the world, twisting and corrupting all they touch.
